The S&P 500 fell 0.2% to 6,953.02, and the Nasdaq Composite declined 0.4% to 23,141.97. The Dow Jones Industrial Average, however, climbed 0.2% to 50,246.92, after scaling a new peak of 50,512.79 earlier in the session. Utilities, real estate, and materials led the gainers, while financials, communication services, and technology were among the steepest decliners. Altruist on Tuesday unveiled an AI tool that helps financial advisers personalize strategies for clients and create pay stubs, account statements, and other documents, Bloomberg reported, citing the company's statement. Raymond James Financial (RJF) sank nearly 9%, among the worst performers on the Nasdaq. Charles Schwab (SCHW) and LPL Financial (LPLA) slumped 7% and 8%, respectively. Meanwhile, retail sales unexpectedly held steady in December, the US Census Bureau said Tuesday, as consumers appeared to pull back on spending at the end of 2025 after kicking the holiday season off at a strong pace. A flat reading compares with the Bloomberg-compiled consensus for a 0.4% gain. November was left unrevised at 0.6% growth, the Census Bureau said. Most US Treasury yields fell intraday, with the two-year rate down 2.9 basis points to 3.45%, and the 10-year rate dropped 5.5 basis points 4.14%. 01:49 PM EST, 02/10/2026 (MT Newswires) -- US equity indexes traded mixed midday Tuesday as an unexpected pause in December retail sales sent government bond yields lower. The Dow Jones Industrial Average climbed 0.2% to 50,210.8, after scaling a new peak of 50,512.79 earlier in the session. The S&P 500 fell 0.1% to 6,956.3, and the Nasdaq Composite declined 0.3% to 23,183.8, giving up earlier gains. Utilities, real estate, and materials led the gainers, while financials were among the steepest decliners. Retail sales unexpectedly held steady in December, the US Census Bureau said Tuesday, as consumers appeared to pull back on spending at the end of 2025 after kicking the holiday season off at a strong pace. A flat reading compares with the Bloomberg-compiled consensus for a 0.4% gain. November was left unrevised at 0.6% growth, the Census Bureau said. Meanwhile, business inventories rose 0.1% in November, versus expectations for a 0.2% increase in a Bloomberg-compiled survey and a 0.2% increase in the previous month. The quarterly US employment cost index rose by 0.7% in Q4, slower than the 0.8% gain in the previous quarter, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported on Tuesday. The print was below consensus for a 0.8% gain in a Bloomberg-compiled poll. Most US Treasury yields fell intraday, with the two-year rate lower by 3.3 basis points to 3.45%, and the 10-year rate dropped 5.1 basis points 4.15%. In company news, Datadog (DDOG) shares surged 16%, the top gainer on the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq, after the company reported Q4 adjusted earnings and revenue above market expectations. S&P Global (SPGI) shares slumped 7.6%, among the worst performers on the S&P 500, after the company's Q4 adjusted earnings missed analysts' expectations, and its 2026 adjusted earnings outlook also lagged market consensus. In the precious metals market, gold futures slipped 0.7% to $5,045.6 per troy ounce and silver futures fell 2.6% to $80.45 per troy ounce. In the energy market, West Texas Intermediate crude oil futures fell 0.6% to $63.95 a barrel.
response: El martes el SPX retrocedió -0,33% y el NDX cayó -0,56%, en una rueda de sesgo defensivo condicionada por un dato de ventas minoristas de diciembre que sorprendió con variación nula frente a una expectativa de +0,4%, reforzando la percepción de enfriamiento del consumo y empujando a la baja las tasas, con la 2Y cayendo cerca de 3 bps y la 10Y alrededor de 5 bps, lo que no alcanzó para sostener a los activos de riesgo; la presión sobre los índices estuvo explicada principalmente por tecnología y comunicaciones, con debilidad en GOOG (-1,78%), META (-0,96%), NVDA (-0,79%), AMZN (-0,84%) y AAPL (-0,34%), además de semiconductores vía SOXX (-0,38%), mientras que XLK cerró -0,56% y XLC fue la excepción sectorial con +0,60%; entre los principales ganadores del día se destacó TSLA con +1,89%, en tanto que el segmento de computación cuántica mostró fuerte corrección con RGTI (-3,52%) y QBTS (-3,63%); entre los sectores rezagados se observaron XLV (-0,63%), XLP (-0,32%) y XLE (-0,11%), en una jornada también marcada por la baja de metales preciosos con GLD (-0,99%) y un VIX en alza de 2,94%, reflejando mayor aversión al riesgo pese al retroceso de los rendimientos.

Nasdaq dropped 1.6% to 22,532.1, with the S&P 500 down 1.3% to 6,796.4 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average lower by 1.2% to 48,918.5. Materials, consumer discretionary, and technology paced the decliners. Utilities and consumer staples were the sole gainers, reflecting a classic defensive tilt. January's job cut announcements soared to the highest since October, driven by layoffs at United Parcel Service (UPS) and Amazon.com (AMZN), Challenger Gray & Christmas said. A total of 108,435 layoff plans were disclosed, more than triple the tally in December and up 118% year over year. Meanwhile, job openings fell to 6.542 million in December, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, below the 7.25 million expected in a Bloomberg-compiled survey and down from 6.928 million reported in November. US Treasury yields slumped, with the 10-year down eight basis points to 4.20% and the two-year plunged 9.2 basis points to 3.47%. Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) reported higher Q4 earnings and revenue overnight, but it expects capital expenditure to increase to $175 billion to $185 billion this year. The top end of that forecast would be more than double its 2025 capex spend, CNBC reported. Shares of Alphabet were lower in the final leg of trading, albeit off session highs. The second-biggest laggard on the Dow was Amazon, which fell 4%. The online retailer is expected to report quarterly earnings after the bell. https://www.wsj.com/livecoverage/stock-market-today-dow-sp-500-nasdaq-02-05-2026?mod=hp_lead_pos2 https://www.wsj.com/business/earnings/amazon-earnings-q4-2025-amzn-stock-996e5cc2?mod=hp_lead_pos4
response:
05/02/2026 (jueves)

El jueves el SPX cayó -1,23% y el NDX profundizó la baja con -1,77% en una rueda claramente risk-off, con suba del VIX (+17,81%) y liderazgo negativo de tecnología y consumo discrecional, en un contexto de datos laborales más débiles de lo esperado, con fuertes anuncios de despidos y una caída marcada de job openings, lo que presionó a los cíclicos y empujó a la baja a las tasas, con la 10Y retrocediendo hasta 4,20%; el castigo en los índices estuvo explicado principalmente por MSFT (-4,95%), AMZN (-4,42%), NVDA (-1,33%) y TSLA (-2,17%), mientras que XLK cerró en baja de -1,80% y XLE cayó -1,17%, acompañando la fuerte corrección del Futuro WTI (-2,93%) y de GLD (-2,66%); en el after market el foco pasó claramente a AMZN, que llegó a caer con fuerza desde el cierre de 222,69 hacia la zona de 206, reacción asociada a un reporte con EPS por debajo de lo esperado y, sobre todo, a una guía de CAPEX significativamente más alta, reforzando las preocupaciones del mercado sobre presión en márgenes en 2026, especialmente vinculada a inversiones en infraestructura y AI, lo que amplificó el sesgo negativo del NDX; entre los pocos nombres que lograron sostenerse destacó META (+0,18%), mientras que los segmentos defensivos mostraron relativa resiliencia, con XLP apenas -0,08% y XLV -0,76%, sin lograr compensar el deterioro general del mercado.

The S&P 500 was up 0.5% to 6,984.2 after hitting a record 6,988.82 earlier in the session. The Nasdaq Composite advanced 1% to 23,847.5, and the Dow fell 0.9% to 48,990.7. The financials sector was among the trio of decliners in the final leg of trading. Technology shares gained ahead of quarterly earnings from Microsoft (MSFT), Meta Platforms (META), and Tesla (TSLA) on Wednesday. Shares of Corning (GLW) surged 15%, the top gainer on the S&P 500, after the company said it signed a multiyear, up to $6 billion deal to supply optical fiber, cable, and connectivity products to support the construction of Meta Platforms' US data centers. UnitedHealth (UNH) is among the health insurance stocks falling hard after the Trump administration proposed nearly flat rates for Medicare insurers in 2027. UnitedHealth's shares plunged 20%, the worst performer on the Dow. In economic news, the Conference Board's measure of consumer confidence dived to 84.5 in January, its lowest since May 2014, from 94.2 in December and below the 91.0 expected in a Bloomberg-compiled survey. https://www.wsj.com/economy/central-banking/fed-set-to-pause-rate-cuts-with-no-clear-path-to-resuming-9898b91b?mod=hp_lead_pos6
response:
27/01/2026 (martes)

El martes el SPX avanzó +0,41% y marcó nuevos máximos históricos, mientras el NDX subió +0,88%, impulsados por una fuerte performance de tecnología y semiconductores en la antesala de balances clave, con XLK +1,35% y SOXX +2,33% como principales soportes, y aportes destacados de MSFT +2,19%, AMZN +2,63%, AAPL +1,12% y NVDA +1,10%, en contraste con la debilidad de comunicaciones (XLC -0,74%) y un marcado castigo en salud (XLV -1,68%), que limitó el avance del mercado más amplio; el VIX subió +0,80%, reflejando cierta cobertura pese al tono positivo de los índices, en una rueda también atravesada por un dato macro negativo, con la confianza del consumidor del Conference Board cayendo a 84,5, mínimo desde 2014 y muy por debajo de lo esperado, mientras energía acompañó el sesgo alcista con XLE +0,91% en línea con el fuerte rebote del Futuro WTI (+2,95%) y el oro también mostró fortaleza (GLD +2,43%); entre los principales ganadores se destacaron IONQ +4,89%, QBTS +3,96% y EWZ +3,50%, mientras TSLA cayó -0,99% en la previa de resultados y EMB cerró prácticamente sin cambios (-0,04%).
